item.title: OpenAI 的新产品得到了美国国家安全局前局长的支持
item.description:
保罗-中曾根表示，他 "积极参与 "了对 o1 车型的安全监督

。【原文：

Paul Nakasone says he was ‘heavily involved’ in safety oversight of o1 models

】

item.title: 美联储利率决议、鲍威尔新闻发布会分析
item.description: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔摄影师：Sarah Silbiger/Bloomberg【原文：Jerome Powell Photographer: Sarah Silbiger/Bloomberg】

item.title: 几内亚越狱的前军政府官员在利比里亚被捕
item.description: 几内亚前军政府一名成员于 11 月越狱，他的律师周三表示，他已在邻国利比里亚被警方逮捕。【原文：A member of Guinea’s former military junta who escaped from jail in November has been arrested by police in neighboring Liberia, his lawyer said on Wednesday.】

item.title: ETF 与波动率之争因微策略 200% 杠杆押注而白热化
item.description: 上个月刚刚被称为华尔街有史以来最不稳定的 ETF，在一款增加了更多杠杆的竞争产品上市后，已经被取代了。【原文：An ETF that just last month was dubbed the most volatile to ever hit Wall Street has already been upstaged, after the debut of a competing product that adds even more leverage.】

item.title: 延迟休假和长时间工作是小额债券专业人士欢欣鼓舞的理由
item.description: 对于贝丝-库里奇（Beth Coolidge）来说，今年创纪录的市政债券销售速度只意味着偶尔休息一天，而不是长达一周的假期。这位奥本海默公司（Oppenheimer & Co.【原文：For Beth Coolidge, the record pace of municipal bond sales this year means only an occasional day off rather than week-long vacations. The head of public finance at Oppenheimer & Co. isn’t complaining.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚政府计划对中央银行进行 "世代交替
item.description: 哥伦比亚政府希望通过任命有 "新 "想法的年轻经济学家来动摇其政策被哥伦比亚政府归咎于经济疲软的中央银行。【原文：Colombia’s government wants to shake up the central bank whose policies it blames for the weak economy by appointing young economists with “fresh” ideas.】

item.title: 直觉机器因与美国国家航空航天局（NASA）签订近太空网格协议而股价大涨
item.description: 直觉机器公司（Intuitive Machines Inc.这份合同的价值可能高达 48 亿美元。【原文：Intuitive Machines Inc. shares are surging after the space exploration firm said it won another NASA contract. This one could be worth as much as $4.8 billion.】

item.title: 波音观察家称可能的股权出售可避免降级
item.description: 分析师和市场人士表示，如果波音公司决定筹集资金，这将有助于该公司至少在几个月内避免评级下调。【原文：Should Boeing Co. decide to raise equity, it would help the company fend off a ratings downgrade for at least a couple of months, analysts and market participants said.】

item.title: 德国 Varta 调整重组计划以赢得舒尔茨申贷款人的青睐
item.description: 陷入困境的德国电池生产商瓦尔塔公司（Varta AG）调整了重组计划，以帮助赢得一个重要贷款人集团的支持，为重组计划获得批准铺平道路。【原文：Embattled German battery-maker Varta AG has adjusted its restructuring plan to help win the support of a key group of lenders, paving the way for its approval.】

item.title: 美国多户住宅完工量激增，为租金带来好兆头
item.description: 8 月份，美国多户住宅单位的竣工量飙升至五十年来的新高，这一发展态势可能有助于缓解租金压力。【原文：Builder completions of US multifamily housing units soared to a five-decade high in August, a development that will probably help ease pressure on rents.】

item.title: Altice 债权人提出可能导致德拉希失去控制权的计划
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Altice 法国公司的一大批有担保债权人向该公司发出了一份解决其 244 亿欧元（约合 272 亿美元）债务问题的建议书，该建议书提出了亿万富翁帕特里克-德拉希（Patrick Drahi）失去控制权的可能性。【原文：A large group of Altice France secured creditors sent the company a proposal to fix its €24.4 billion ($27.2 billion) debt pile that raises the possibility of billionaire owner Patrick Drahi losing control, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 垃圾债券投资者在 "降息派对 "前抢占先机
item.description: 美联储迫在眉睫的降息正在推动美国企业债券市场中风险最高的一角反弹，但一些投资者担心这场狂欢可能不会持久。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s looming rate cuts are fueling a rally in the riskiest corner of the US corporate bond market, but some investors are concerned the party may not last.】

item.title: 纽约市交通系统计划耗资 654 亿美元升级改造中央车站和地铁
item.description: 纽约市交通系统正在寻求在未来五年内投资 654 亿美元，用于购买数千辆轨道车辆、升级变电站、翻新中央车站列车库以及加固车站和轨道以应对极端天气。【原文：New York City’s transit system is seeking to invest $65.4 billion over the next five years to purchase thousands of rail cars, upgrade power substations, renovate the Grand Central Terminal trainshed and fortify stations and tracks against extreme weather.】

item.title: 摩根大通和瑞银加入国际清算银行基于区块链的跨境支付改革计划
item.description: 国际清算银行（Bank for International Settlements）已经为一个基于区块链的项目召集了全球最大的几家银行和信用卡公司，该项目旨在彻底改革全球的跨境支付。【原文：The Bank for International Settlements has lined up some of the world’s largest banks and credit card companies for a blockchain-based project that aims to overhaul cross-border payments worldwide.】

item.title: 南非实际利率创 19 年新高，不太可能大幅下调
item.description: 在物价压力降温之后，南非经通胀调整后的实际利率达到了 19 年来的最高水平，但这不太可能使央行有胆量将借贷成本削减超过四分之一个百分点。【原文：South Africa’s real, inflation-adjusted interest rates reached the highest level in 19 years after price pressures cooled, but that’s unlikely to embolden the central bank to cut borrowing costs by more than a quarter point.】

item.title: Kinaxis 化解激进分子压力，寻求潜在出售方案
item.description: 加拿大软件供应商 Kinaxis Inc. 回击了敦促该公司寻求出售的激进投资者，称其专注于为股东创造价值。【原文：Canadian software provider Kinaxis Inc. pushed back against activist investors urging the company to seek a sale, saying it’s focused on creating shareholder value.】

item.title: YouTube 与 Sea's Shopee 携手进军亚洲在线购物市场
item.description: Sea Ltd.的在线零售部门Shopee与Alphabet Inc.的YouTube在印度尼西亚达成了一项协议，打赌这个视频平台将帮助它吸引更多的购物者，并在其最大的市场上领先于竞争对手TikTok和Lazada。【原文：Sea Ltd.’s online-retail arm Shopee struck a pact with Alphabet Inc.’s YouTube in Indonesia, betting the video platform will help it attract more shoppers and stay ahead of rivals TikTok and Lazada in its biggest market.】

item.title: 亚马逊将仓库工人时薪至少提高 1.50 美元
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正在将其仓库小时工的工资每小时至少提高 1.50 美元，并在他们的福利待遇中增加 Prime 会员资格。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is raising the pay of its hourly warehouse workers by at least $1.50 an hour and tacking on Prime memberships to their benefit package.】

item.title: 对冲基金回避巴西贸易 赢得华尔街拥趸
item.description: 华尔街一些最大的银行正在告诉客户看好巴西，呼吁结束今年困扰当地市场的萎靡不振。【原文：Some of Wall Street’s biggest banks are telling clients to place bullish bets on Brazil, calling an end to the malaise that has plagued local markets this year.】

item.title: 澳大利亚努力解决住房危机，因为政客们取消了
item.description: 澳大利亚解决住房危机的最新尝试陷入了政治僵局，因为该国的可用租赁面积徘徊在历史最低点附近。【原文：Australia’s latest attempts to solve its housing crisis are stuck in political gridlock as the amount of available rental space in the nation hovers near a record low.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会准备就股票定价和交易所费用改革进行表决
item.description: 本周三，美国证券交易委员会（US Securities and Exchange Commission）将对最终规则进行投票表决，将数千种股票和交易所交易基金（ETF）的报价增量降至 1 美分以下。【原文：The price increments at which thousands of stocks and ETFs are quoted look set for an overhaul Wednesday, when the US Securities and Exchange Commission votes on final rules to reduce them to less than 1 cent.】

item.title: Costanoa Ventures 逆势融资 3.94 亿美元
item.description: Costanoa Ventures 为两只新基金募集了 3.94 亿美元的资金，而此时许多中小型风险投资公司正在为引进新资金而苦苦挣扎。【原文：Costanoa Ventures has raised $394 million for two new funds, financing that comes at a time when many small and midsized venture firms are struggling to bring in fresh capital.】

item.title: 暴雪联合创始人的新公司 Dreamhaven 旨在重现昔日魔力
item.description:
这家游戏新贵正在发行一款由 Fuzzybot  开发的多人动作游戏，并将于 10 月份宣布其首款内部开发的游戏

。【原文：

The gaming upstart is publishing a multiplayer action game from Fuzzybot and will announce its first internally developed title in October

】

item.title: 人工智能改变角色，货币交易员正在成为 "算法 DJ
item.description: 算法交易正在从根本上改变货币交易商的角色，导致他们质疑谁将对日益依赖计算机模型的交易负责。【原文：Algorithmic trading is radically changing the role of currency dealers, leading them to question who will be responsible for the growing reliance on computer models.】

item.title: 德国启动原材料基金以加强供应链
item.description: 德国政府正在启动一项 10 亿欧元（11 亿美元）的原材料投资基金，以限制对中国等重要矿产生产国的依赖。【原文：The German government is launching a €1 billion ($1.1 billion) fund for investment in raw materials as it seeks to limit dependency on producers such as China for critical minerals.】

item.title: 必和必拓化肥老板押宝低成本钾肥挑战对手
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）项目负责人表示，即使化肥价格疲软，该公司预计其价值 106 亿美元的加拿大钾盐矿也能赚钱。【原文：BHP Group expects its $10.6 billion potash mine in Canada to make money even with weakened fertilizer prices, says the head of the project.】

item.title: 罗杰斯以 35 亿美元收购 BCE 在枫叶体育公司的股份
item.description: 罗杰斯通信公司（Rogers Communications Inc. ）将以 47 亿加元（35 亿美元）的价格收购 BCE 公司在枫叶体育娱乐有限公司（Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Ltd. ）37.5% 的股份，从而使这家电信巨头获得这家体育公司的多数股权，该公司最有价值的资产包括多伦多枫叶冰球俱乐部和多伦多猛龙队。【原文：Rogers Communications Inc. is buying BCE Inc.’s 37.5% stake in Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Ltd. for C$4.7 billion ($3.5 billion), giving the telecommunications giant a majority stake in the sports company whose most valuable assets include the Toronto Maple Leafs hockey club and the Toronto Raptors.】

item.title: 大众汽车与中国合作伙伴上汽集团因销量萎缩将关闭汽车工厂
item.description: 大众汽车公司及其最古老的中国合作伙伴计划关闭在中国的一家工厂，并可能关闭更多工厂，以应对内燃机汽车需求的放缓。【原文：Volkswagen AG and its oldest Chinese partner plan to shutter one plant in China and possibly more in response to slowing demand for combustion-engine cars, in a further pullback after the venture’s first factory ceased output.】

item.title: 新聊天机器人 ETF 承诺模仿沃伦-巴菲特和大卫-泰珀
item.description: 这可能是华尔街利用新式人工智能工具模仿金融传奇的最大胆的尝试。【原文：It might just be the most audacious bid on Wall Street to exploit newfangled AI tools to mimic the legends of finance.】

item.title: 滚出加拿大多伦多证券交易所反弹后一些策略师转入防御
item.description: 自加拿大央行 6 月份开始降息以来，加拿大主要股指已飙升近 8%，表现优于 S&P 500 指数。一些策略师说，这是一个机会—；他们敦促投资者抛售，甚至完全退出加拿大股票。【原文：Canada’s main stock index has surged almost 8% since its central bank began cutting interest rates in June, outperforming the S&P 500. Some strategists say that’s an opportunity — they’re urging investors to sell down or even get out of Canadian stocks altogether.】
